00020 /**
00021  * @file   LineFile.cpp
00022  * @author Mybrid Spalding
00023  * @date   Wed Feb  2 10:04:48 PST 2011
00024  * @brief  Test class for reading files by line that is platform safe.
00025  */
00026 
00027 //
00028 #include "util/LineFile.h"
00029 //
00030 #include "util/Err.h"
00031 #include "util/Fs.h"
00032 #include "util/Util.h"
00033 //
00034 
00035 /**
00036  * What type of line endings do we see in this input stream?
00037  * @param input - stream to look for '\r','\n', or '\r\n' in.
00038  * @return type of line endings we expect in the future.
00039  */
00040 static enum LineFile::FileLineEnding _determineLineEndingType(std::ifstream & fileStream)
00041 {
00042   enum LineFile::FileLineEnding ending = LineFile::UNKNOWN;
00043   while(fileStream.good()) {
00044     char c1 = fileStream.get();
00045     // '\r' alone indicates mac, '\r\n' indicates dos
00046     if(c1 == '\r') {
00047       if(fileStream.good() && fileStream.get() == '\n') {
00048         ending = LineFile::DOS;
00049       } else {
00050         ending = LineFile::MAC;
00051       }
00052       break;
00053     }
00054     // is it a unix file?
00055     else if(c1 == '\n') {
00056       ending = LineFile::UNIX;
00057       break;
00058     }
00059   }
00060   // reset stream back to beginning of file.
00061   fileStream.seekg(0);
00062   return ending;
00063 }
00064 
00065 /**
00066  * Constructor.
00067  */
00068 LineFile::LineFile(): m_endType(UNKNOWN) {}
00069 
00070 /**
00071  * Destructor.
00072  */
00073 LineFile::~LineFile()
00074 {
00075   if(m_fileStream.is_open()) {
00076     m_fileStream.close();
00077   }
00078 };
00079 
00080 /**
00081  * Open file fileName or die trying.
00082  * @param char * fileName - full path of fileName to be opened.
00083  */
00084 std::ifstream & LineFile::open(const std::string& fileName, bool abortOnError)
00085 {
00086 
00087   if(m_fileStream.is_open()) {
00088     m_fileStream.close();
00089   }
00090 
00091   m_fileName = fileName;
00092 
00093   Fs::aptOpen(m_fileStream, m_fileName, std::ios_base::in);
00094   if(!m_fileStream.is_open()) {
00095     if(abortOnError) {
00096       Err::errAbort("Can't open file " + FS_QUOTE_PATH(fileName) + " to read.");
00097     }
00098   } else {
00099     m_endType = _determineLineEndingType(m_fileStream);
00100   }
00101 
00102   return m_fileStream;
00103 }
00104 
00105 
00106 /**
00107  * Close file streams.
00108  */
00109 void LineFile::close()
00110 {
00111   if(m_fileStream.is_open()) {
00112     m_fileStream.close();
00113   }
00114 }
00115 
00116 /**
00117  * LineFile::getline
00118  *
00119  * Read the next line if the stream is open.
00120  * When eof is reached, close the file.
00121  * @return -
00122  * at EOF.
00123  */
00124 bool LineFile::getline(std::string & line, bool trim)
00125 {
00126 
00127   line.clear();
00128 
00129   if(!m_fileStream.is_open() || m_fileStream.fail() || m_fileStream.eof()) {
00130     return false;
00131   }
00132 
00133 
00134   if(m_endType == MAC) {
00135     std::getline(m_fileStream, line, '\r');
00136   } else {
00137     std::getline(m_fileStream, line, '\n');
00138     // if ms-dos chop off the '\r'
00139     if(m_endType == DOS && line.length() > 0) {
00140       line.erase(line.end() - 1);
00141     }
00142   }
00143 
00144   if(trim && (line.length() > 0)) {
00145     Util::trimString(line);
00146   }
00147 
00148   return true;
00149 }
